<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">/// RABasic provides a minimal implementation of the basic register allocation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">/// algorithm. It prioritizes live virtual registers by spill weight and spills</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">/// whenever a register is unavailable. This is not practical in production but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="comment">/// provides a useful baseline both for measuring other allocators and comparing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the speed of the basic algorithm against other styles of allocators.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-regallocbasic-cpp-/rabasic"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-regallocbasic-cpp-/rabasic/#a8e9b0771270f5d554cb9b66c1fc2f586">RABasic</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunctionpass/#a29c81d2386f4a727c6d33413807530c8">MachineFunctionPass</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="normal">                </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regallocbase/#a012fb04b333e4c8875594766fd9f076a">RegAllocBase</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Driver for the register assignment and splitting heuristics.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Manages iteration over the LiveIntervalUnions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This is a minimal implementation of register assignment and splitting that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// spills whenever we run out of registers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// selectOrSplit can only be called once per live virtual register. We then do a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// single interference test for each register the correct class until we find an</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// available register. So, the number of interference tests in the worst case is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// |vregs| &#42; |machineregs|. And since the number of interference tests is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// minimal, there is no value in caching them outside the scope of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// selectOrSplit().</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-regallocbasic-cpp-/rabasic/#a6f1fe32957cb698200b26a3a96e0145c"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcregister">MCRegister</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-regallocbasic-cpp-/rabasic/#a6f1fe32957cb698200b26a3a96e0145c">RABasic::selectOrSplit</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveinterval">LiveInterval</a> &amp;VirtReg,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;Register&gt;</a> &amp;SplitVRegs) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Order =</Highlight></CodeLine>
